intro: Loasa pilosa, commonly known as the hairy loasa, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of forests.
